Text: Man is by nature a political animal.
Label: NOT_MANIPULATIVE

Text: But if thought corrupts language, language can also corrupt thought.
Label: NOT_MANIPULATIVE

Text: Politics is the art of the possible, the attainable — the art of the next best.
Label: NOT_MANIPULATIVE

Text: One of the penalties of refusing to participate in politics is that you end up being governed by your inferiors.
Label: MANIPULATIVE

Text: Since love and fear can hardly exist together, if we must choose between them, it is far safer to be feared than loved.
Label: MANIPULATIVE

Text: Men are driven by two principal impulses, either by love or by fear.
Label: MANIPULATIVE

Text: All courses of action are risky, so prudence is not in avoiding danger, but calculating risk and acting decisively.
Label: NOT_MANIPULATIVE

Text: It is not titles that honour men, but men that honour titles.
Label: NOT_MANIPULATIVE

Text: How we live is so different from how we ought to live that he who studies what ought to be done rather than what is done will learn the way to his downfall rather than to his preservation.
Label: NOT_MANIPULATIVE

Text: He who wishes to be obeyed must know how to command.
Label: NOT_MANIPULATIVE

Text: Men are so simple of mind, and so much dominated by their immediate needs, that a deceitful man will always find plenty who are ready to be deceived.
Label: MANIPULATIVE

Text: Whosoever desires constant success must change his conduct with the times.
Label: NOT_MANIPULATIVE

Text: The worst illiterate is the political illiterate.
Label: MANIPULATIVE

Text: The genuflection toward 'fairness' is a familiar newsroom piety.
Label: MANIPULATIVE

Text: Perhaps most strikingly of all, it was clear in 1988 that those inside the process had congealed into a permanent political class.
Label: NOT_MANIPULATIVE

Text: What is above all needed is to let the meaning choose the word, and not the other way around.
Label: NOT_MANIPULATIVE

Text: The great enemy of clear language is insincerity.
Label: MANIPULATIVE

Text: Political language is designed to make lies sound truthful and murder respectable.
Label: MANIPULATIVE

Text: Never use a metaphor, simile, or other figure of speech which you are used to seeing in print.
Label: NOT_MANIPULATIVE

Text: Never use a long word where a short one will do.
Label: NOT_MANIPULATIVE
